meanings.definition: To rotate or revolve together with another object.
meanings.sent1: The planets corotate around the sun in our solar system.
meanings.sent2: The wheels of the car corotate smoothly as it moves forward.
meanings.sent3: The dancers corotate gracefully on the dance floor, creating a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the clock corotate harmoniously, keeping time ticking away.
meanings.sent5: The Earth and the moon corotate in a celestial dance that has lasted for eons.

meanings.definition: To move or spin in conjunction with another object.
meanings.sent1: The synchronized swimmers corotate in perfect harmony during their routine.
meanings.sent2: The propellers of the airplane corotate to generate lift and propel the aircraft forward.
meanings.sent3: The wind turbines corotate with the breeze, generating clean energy for the town.
meanings.sent4: The figure skaters corotate on the ice, creating a beautiful display of skill and grace.
meanings.sent5: The wheels of the bicycle corotate smoothly as the rider pedals along the path.
